name: The Brattle Group
tagline: Leading economic consulting firm specializing in litigation and regulatory economics
description: The Brattle Group answers complex economic, finance, and regulatory questions for corporations, law firms, and governments around the world. We are distinguished by the clarity of our insights and the credibility of our experts, which include leading international academics and industry specialists. Brattle has over 500 talented professionals across three continents. For more information, please visit brattle.com.
known_for: Deep expertise in economic and financial analysis for litigation and regulatory proceedings. Distinguished by strong academic ties—many principals are leading university professors. Known for rigorous, data-driven approaches to complex economic questions and expert testimony that withstands intense scrutiny in courtrooms and regulatory hearings.
career_path: Research Analyst (2-3 yrs) → Research Associate (2-3 yrs) → Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Senior Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Associate (3-4 yrs) → Senior Associate (3-4 yrs) → Principal

recruiting.process: Resume → First Round (behavioral + case discussion) → Final Round (multiple 1-on-1 interviews + case exercises + lunch with analysts)
recruiting.unique: Case interviews focus on interactive discussion around real consulting scenarios rather than traditional business cases. Emphasis on critical thinking, economic intuition, data interpretation, and oral communication. Candidates may choose between economic theory, regression, or data visualization questions.
recruiting.timeline: Fall on-campus recruiting with behavioral interviews, second round in winter. Decisions typically within 1-2 weeks of interview day. Average hiring process takes about 3 weeks.

byu.tip: Very small BYU presence (2 current alumni). Network with current BYU alumni at the firm and emphasize quantitative skills and economics background. Strong fit for students with economics, finance, or statistics majors.
